en: Does this look good on me?
I hear you have a new girlfriend.
zh: 我听说你交了新女朋友。

en: Would you please take a picture?
zh: 能请你帮我拍张照片吗？

en: Could you please take a picture?
zh: 能请你帮我拍张照片吗？

en: I slipped on my geta and dashed outside.
zh: 我穿着木屐滑了一下，然后冲了出去。

en: Please put your shoes in the getabako when you take them off.
zh: 脱鞋后请把鞋子放到鞋柜里。

en: Please put your shoes in the shoebox when you take them off.
zh: 脱鞋后请把鞋子放到鞋盒里。

en: What will I do? The strap on one of my geta has come undone.
zh: 我该怎么办？我的木屐带子断了。

en: What will I do? The strap on one of my geta is broken.
zh: 我该怎么办？我的木屐带子断了。

en: Tokyo is one of the largest cities in the world.
zh: 东京是世界上最大的城市之一。

en: Happiness and sadness only last for a time.
What do you want to do tomorrow?
She confessed her love to him.
If dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
zh: 如果七点饭还没好，我就去餐厅吃了。

en: Well, if dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
zh: 好吧，如果七点饭还没好，我就去餐厅吃了。

en: Hey, if dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
zh: 嘿，如果七点饭还没好，我就去餐厅吃了。

en: Organic matter is formed by large molecules.
zh: 有机物是由大分子构成的。

en: That ticket is good until April 29th.
How long did you stay in Boston?
How long do you plan to stay in Boston?
zh: 你计划在波士顿待多久？

en: He has little money, but he gets by.
zh: 他没什么钱，但他还能勉强过活。

en: He has hardly any money, but he gets by.
zh: 他几乎没什么钱，但他还能勉强过活。

en: He has almost no money, but he gets by.
zh: 他几乎没有钱，但他还能勉强过活。

en: Franz Liszt created the concept of the "symphonic poem". This is a composition for orchestra that uses music to describe nonmusical content. This could include, for example, people, legendary figures, landscapes, or paintings.
zh: 弗朗茨·李斯特创造了“交响诗”的概念。这是一种为管弦乐队创作的乐曲，它用音乐来描述非音乐内容。这可以包括，例如，人物、传奇人物、风景或绘画。

en: The best-known compositions by Franz Liszt are his nineteen Hungarian Rhapsodies, but he also created beautiful sonatas, symphonies, concerti, songs, and religious compositions.
zh: 弗朗茨·李斯特最著名的作品是他创作的十九首匈牙利狂想曲，但他还创作了优美的奏鸣曲、交响曲、协奏曲、歌曲和宗教作品。

en: The best-known compositions by Franz Liszt are his nineteen Hungarian Rhapsodies, but he also created beautiful sonatas, symphonies, concerti, Lieder, and religious compositions.
zh: 弗朗茨·李斯特最著名的作品是他创作的十九首匈牙利狂想曲，但他还创作了优美的奏鸣曲、交响曲、协奏曲、艺术歌曲和宗教作品。

en: I agreed to take on the job realizing that I had no choice.
zh: 我同意接受这份工作，因为我知道我别无选择。

en: "Is this really a natural expression?" "Let's ask Mr. Google."
zh: “这真的是一种自然的表达吗？” “我们问问谷歌先生吧。”

en: The sentence got longer after it was re-written.
Let's go to the flea market tomorrow.
zh: 我们明天去跳蚤市场吧。

en: The teacher and I sat down face to face.
zh: 老师和我面对面地坐了下来。

en: Why don't you take a break now?
zh: 你现在为什么不休息一下？

en: Tom is more experienced in business than me.
zh: 汤姆在商业方面比我更有经验。

en: I was tired of the work.
Tom doesn't like being around children because he's always afraid of catching a cold from one of them.
zh: 汤姆不喜欢和孩子们在一起，因为他总是害怕被他们传染感冒。

en: In the hands of a wise person, things become really simple. It's a mediocre person, pretending to be wise, that makes an easy thing sound difficult.
zh: 在智者手中，事情会变得非常简单。只有庸才，假装聪明，才会把简单的事情说得很难。

en: Isn't it the case in any language that if you use too many drawn-out words one's expression becomes over-polite.
zh: 难道不是任何语言都是这样吗？如果你使用太多冗长的词语，表达就会变得过于礼貌。

en: I don't get it! Why do I have to take the heat?
zh: 我不明白！为什么我要承担责任？

en: How do I decompress the LZH file?

zh: 我会假装这件事没发生过。
我们会假装这件事没发生过。

en: Because of the heavy fog, we could barely see the road in front of us.
zh: 因为雾很大，我们几乎看不清前面的路。

en: The fog was so dense, we could hardly see anything.
zh: 雾太浓了，我们几乎什么都看不见。

en: After getting out of the shower, Tom wiped the fog off the mirror and shaved.
zh: 洗完澡后，汤姆擦掉镜子上的雾气，刮了胡子。

en: Let's try not to lose each other in this fog.
zh: 我们尽量不要在这雾中走散。

en: Tom and Mary held hands as they watched the fog roll in.
zh: 汤姆和玛丽手牵着手，看着雾气涌来。

en: Tom turned on the car's fog lights.
zh: 汤姆打开了汽车的雾灯。

en: Tom walked away and soon disappeared into the fog.
zh: 汤姆走开了，很快就消失在雾里。

en: We could hear a foghorn in the distance.
zh: 我们能听到远处传来雾角的声音。

en: I feel like I've already seen this movie.
zh: 我觉得我已经看过这部电影了。

en: There's a rumor in my mother's village that we have Japanese ancestors. I don't know what to make of it.
zh: 在我妈妈的村子里有个传言，说我们有日本血统。我不知道该怎么看待这件事。

en: Because of the dense fog, nothing could be seen.
zh: 由于雾很大，什么都看不见。

en: She cried crocodile tears when he left.
zh: 他离开的时候，她假惺惺地哭了起来。

en: I like grapes, but I can't eat too many of them.
zh: 我喜欢葡萄，但是我不能吃太多。

en: This might not have anything to do with our problem.
zh: 这可能和我们的问题没有任何关系。

en: I'm now about as tall as my father.
zh: 我现在和我爸爸差不多高了。

en: His normal position is third baseman.
zh: 他通常的位置是三垒手。

en: Do you want to go together?
Put the wet umbrella in this bag, please.
zh: 请把湿伞放在这个袋子里。

en: Excuse me, I dropped my chopsticks.
zh: 不好意思，我的筷子掉了。

en: Excuse me, I dropped a chopstick.
Is there anything you need to do today?
zh: 你今天有什么事情要做吗？

en: You thought I wouldn't come tonight, didn't you?
zh: 你以为我今晚不会来，是不是？
那些都是非常有名的人。
难道没有其他人能来吗？

en: Isn't anyone else able to come?
zh: 难道没有其他人能来吗？

en: He wrote down the name so he wouldn't forget it.
zh: 他把名字写下来，这样他就不会忘记了。

en: Why don't you calm down? You're really making me cringe.
zh: 你为什么不冷静下来？你真的让我感到难堪。

en: Last night, I fell asleep while talking with Mary on the phone.
zh: 昨晚，我和玛丽在电话里聊天的时候睡着了。

en: When the parents heard the news, they cheered up.
zh: 父母听到这个消息时，他们欢呼起来。

en: As soon as you see this E-mail please reply right away.
zh: 你一看到这封邮件请立刻回复。

en: Please reply as soon as you get this email.
zh: 收到这封邮件后请尽快回复。

en: Please reply as soon as you've read this email.
zh: 请您在阅读完这封邮件后尽快回复。

en: Nagoya is famous for its castle.
zh: 名古屋以它的城堡而闻名。

en: It is entirely up to you.
Which is more important, me or Tatoeba?
Who's more important, me or Tatoeba?
I really like a cloudy sky. Why? I don't even know.
zh: 我真的很喜欢多云的天空。为什么？我也不知道。

en: A dog runs faster than a human.
I have other cards up my sleeve.

zh: 你最喜欢的颜色是什么？

en: Do you have a favorite singer?
My grandmother on my mother's side lives in Osaka.
My grandfather on my mother's side passed away ten years ago.
My paternal grandmother enjoys tea ceremonies.
I may be crazy, but I'm not stupid.
zh: 我可能很疯狂，但我并不蠢。

en: I bought a scarf for my grandfather on my father's side for his 88th birthday.
zh: 我给我爷爷（我爸爸那边的）买了一条围巾，作为他的八十八岁生日礼物。

en: I'm sorry, but I'm already dating someone.
zh: 对不起，我已经有约会对象了。

en: My grandfather on my father's side is celebrating his 88th birthday tomorrow.
zh: 我爷爷（我爸爸那边的）明天要庆祝他的八十八岁生日。

en: My grandfather on my mother's side is celebrating his 60th birthday tomorrow.
zh: 我外公明天要庆祝他的六十岁生日。

en: Love is nothing more than a temporary hormone imbalance.
zh: 爱情只不过是暂时的荷尔蒙失调。

en: The tree's leaves have all fallen.
Do you have a twin sister?
Do you have a twin brother?
A samurai's blood runs in Taro's veins.
zh: 太郎的血管里流淌着武士的血液。
我们看到了所有的事情。

en: I can't get in touch with Tom.
I can't do it by myself.
This puppet is my only friend.
zh: 这个木偶是我唯一的朋友。

en: Nobody wants to be my friend anymore.
zh: 再也没有人想和我做朋友了。

en: Which is more important, me or your job?
zh: 我和你的工作哪个更重要？

en: There is no such a thing as a comprehensive textbook.
zh: 根本没有所谓的综合性教科书。

en: I like the gray sweater more than the purple one.
zh: 我更喜欢灰色的毛衣，而不是紫色的。
你能说一口流利的中文吗？

en: Are you good at speaking Chinese?

zh: 那顶棕色的帽子很旧了。

en: I pawned my guitar in order to pay the rent.
zh: 为了付房租，我把吉他当了。

en: I pawned my guitar so I could pay the rent.
zh: 我把吉他当了，这样我才能付房租。

en: The road winded through the fields.
This sentence is in the present tense.
He who does not work, does not have the right to eat.
There's an apostrophe missing. "It's" and "its" are different. -- I know. It was a typing error.
zh: 这里少了一个撇号。“It's”和“its”是不一样的。——我知道。那是个打字错误。

en: The man I met yesterday was Mr. Hill.
zh: 我昨天遇到的那个人是希尔先生。

en: I didn't think you'd get here so soon.
zh: 我没想到你会这么快到这里。

en: I didn't expect it to cost so much.
zh: 我没想到会花这么多钱。

en: I didn't think it would take this long.
zh: 我没想到会花这么长时间。

en: I didn't expect that Tom would fall in love with Mary.
zh: 我没想到汤姆会爱上玛丽。

en: The person I met yesterday was Tom.
zh: 我昨天遇到的那个人是汤姆。
汤姆好了吗？/汤姆没事了吗？

en: If you get a smartphone, you should download Skype. Telephone bills are such a waste of money.
zh: 如果你买了智能手机，你应该下载Skype。电话费太浪费钱了。

en: My mother doesn't speak much English.

zh: 每个人看起来都松了一口气。

en: In this room there are over 50 tables.
zh: 在这个房间里有超过50张桌子。

en: What is your favorite music group?
zh: 你最喜欢的乐队是什么？

en: It's snowing? Oh, that wasn't called for!
zh: 下雪了？哦，没必要这样吧！

en: Even though what he said was sound, I still wasn't completely convinced.
zh: 即使他说的有道理，我还是没有完全信服。

en: I heard this sentence on the street about an hour ago.
zh: 我大约一个小时前在街上听到了这句话。
那个日语听起来很自然。

en: Don't ask me to choose between you and my job.
zh: 别让我在你和我的工作之间做选择。

en: Don't ask me to choose between you and my children.
zh: 别让我在你和我的孩子之间做选择。

en: A child was washed away by the wave!
zh: 一个孩子被海浪冲走了！

en: Please be careful of gales and large waves.
If you want this marriage to work, you need to choose between spending time with me and working all the time.
zh: 如果你想这段婚姻能维持下去，你需要在花时间陪我和一直工作之间做出选择。

en: She has the bad habit of always being late.
zh: 她有个坏习惯，总是迟到。

en: You shouldn't run around with a toothbrush in your mouth.
zh: 你不应该嘴里含着牙刷到处跑。

en: Tom had a cigarette hanging out of his mouth while he vacantly stared up at the sky.
zh: 汤姆嘴里叼着一根烟，茫然地望着天空。

en: We can't sit there looking wistfully on as this city falls into decay.
zh: 我们不能眼睁睁地看着这座城市衰败而无动于衷。

en: I hardly ever walk to work.

zh: 不幸的是，情况确实如此。
这些衣服是我自己做的。

en: My wife is obsessed with cleanliness.
That child is a bit shy.
There are five apples in the box.
I like Tom best, John second best.
zh: 我最喜欢汤姆，第二喜欢约翰。
汤姆是玛丽的双胞胎兄弟。

en: Is it true that Tom has a twin?
zh: 汤姆有双胞胎是真的吗？

en: I only know a few words.
In spring, one sleeps a sleep that knows no dawn.
The country is in ruins, yet still there are mountains and rivers.
In springtime, the dawn. In summer, the night.
zh: 春天是拂晓。夏天是夜晚。

en: Behold! The beauty of the seasons.

zh: 我被困在我的工作中了。

en: Thank you for the Christmas gift.
Summer grasses, all that remain of warriors' dreams.
zh: 夏日草木，尽是武士们往日的梦想。

en: A lack of exercise is bad for your health.
zh: 缺乏锻炼对你的健康有害。

en: We are listening to the radio.
To love oneself is the beginning of a life-long romance.
zh: 爱自己是终身浪漫的开始。

en: No man is rich enough to buy back his own past.
zh: 没有人富有到可以买回自己的过去。

en: To become popular, you need to be mediocre.
zh: 要想受欢迎，你需要平庸。
我曾经在电视上唱过一次歌。

en: I remember you appeared on television once.
zh: 我记得你曾经上过一次电视。

en: I appeared on television once, but nobody believes me.
zh: 我曾经上过一次电视，但是没人相信我。

en: Once, I had the chance to appear on television.
zh: 有一次，我有机会上电视。

en: I lost my only chance to appear on television.
zh: 我失去了唯一一次上电视的机会。

en: Constantinople fell to the hands of the Ottoman Turks in 1453.
zh: 1453年，君士坦丁堡落入奥斯曼土耳其人手中。

en: You can eat as much as you want.
There are many more vowels in French than in Japanese.
zh: 法语中的元音比日语多得多。

en: I have never seen a rugby match as exciting as yesterday's match.
zh: 我从未见过像昨天那样精彩的橄榄球比赛。

en: Depending on how things go, it's possible there'll be a surprise ending.
zh: 根据情况的发展，可能会有一个意想不到的结局。

en: Do you want to ask me any questions?
I just wanted to give him some advice, but in the end I made him angry.
zh: 我只是想给他一些建议，但结果我惹他生气了。

en: Please pay attention to what I'm saying.

zh: 我们听到了教堂的钟声。

en: I had a strict curfew at my house.
Sorry, but I'm a little slow-witted.
Tom's sentences are really hard to translate.
zh: 汤姆的句子真的很难翻译。

en: When was the last time you saw that cat?
zh: 你上次见到那只猫是什么时候？

en: The population of this country is gradually diminishing.
zh: 这个国家的人口正在逐渐减少。

en: A month is too little time.
French and Arabic are spoken in this country.
zh: 这个国家说法语和阿拉伯语。

en: How long will you be in Boston?
He lost his only son in an accident.
zh: 他在一场事故中失去了他唯一的儿子。

en: Good medicine tastes bitter, good advice is hard to listen to.
zh: 良药苦口利于病，忠言逆耳利于行。

en: I got gastroenteritis the other day, so I went to the hospital.
zh: 前几天我得了肠胃炎，所以去了医院。

en: Gastroenteritis is often caused by the norovirus.
zh: 肠胃炎通常是由诺如病毒引起的。

en: I can't use my left hand because of the plaster cast.
zh: 因为石膏，我不能用我的左手。
汤姆和玛丽幸存下来了。

en: I will always be there for you.

zh: 这可能发生在任何人身上。

en: The Japanese word "mofumofu" is used to describe fluffy and light animals.
zh: 日语单词“mofumofu”用来形容毛茸茸和轻盈的动物。

en: One can walk to school in ten minutes.
zh: 人们可以在十分钟内走到学校。

en: Also, after it is whipped, a fluffy texture emerges.
zh: 而且，经过搅拌后，会出现蓬松的质地。

en: Tom says he's snuggled with his girlfriend, but they haven't yet kissed.
zh: 汤姆说他依偎着他的女朋友，但他们还没有亲吻。
这可能发生在任何人身上。

en: Did you go somewhere this summer?
zh: 你今年夏天去哪里了吗？

en: Tom can't explain the difference between cheap wine and expensive wine.
zh: 汤姆无法解释廉价葡萄酒和昂贵葡萄酒之间的区别。

en: The well is in the middle of this plaza.
I'll go if the weather's good.
It rarely snows in this area.
He likes animals more than people.
zh: 他喜欢动物胜过喜欢人。

en: "Freedom, Equality, Brotherhood" is also Haiti's motto.
zh: “自由、平等、博爱”也是海地的座右铭。

en: I think there are a lot of beautiful women in Australia (YMMV).
zh: 我认为澳大利亚有很多美女（看法可能因人而异）。

en: Does a solution come to mind?
Can you think of a solution?
zh: 你能想到一个解决方案吗？

en: As a result of new ultra-light materials, our product now only weighs about half as much as before!
zh: 由于新型超轻材料的出现，我们的产品现在重量只有原来的一半左右！

en: At last, I managed to find him.

zh: 同性婚姻在这里是合法的。

en: I think you should stop smoking.
I think that you should stop smoking.
Greece was the cradle of western civilization.
zh: 希腊是西方文明的摇篮。

en: There are also some children who don't like apples.
zh: 也有一些孩子不喜欢苹果。

en: The plane still hasn't taken off.
The woman was sitting between two men.
zh: 那个女人坐在两个男人中间。

en: Under the shadow of the oak tree, Tom and Mary recited haiku to each other all day long.
zh: 在橡树的阴影下，汤姆和玛丽整天互相吟诵俳句。

en: Tom loved Mary, but she didn't like him at all.
zh: 汤姆爱玛丽，但她一点也不喜欢他。

en: We'll arrive in three hours if we drive.
zh: 如果我们开车，三个小时后就能到达。

en: What time did the meeting end?
What time do you have dinner?
Which group is your friend in?
I speak Berber to my teacher.
zh: 我和我的老师说柏柏尔语。

en: He speaks Berber to his teachers.
zh: 他和他的老师们说柏柏尔语。

en: Hi. If I'm not mistaken, you're our new neighbors, aren't you?
zh: 你好。如果我没记错的话，你们是我们的新邻居，对吧？

en: Please take a seat and wait.
One morning, when I woke up, I found that all the bills in my wallet had changed into two-thousand yen bills.
zh: 有一天早上，我醒来时，发现我钱包里的所有钞票都变成了两千日元的钞票。

en: I woke up one morning to find that all the bills in my wallet had turned into two-thousand yen bills.
zh: 有一天早上我醒来，发现我钱包里的所有钞票都变成了两千日元的钞票。

en: It's a lot of trouble to write my name, because it takes 50 strokes to write both my first and last names.
zh: 写我的名字很麻烦，因为我的名字和姓加起来要写50笔。

en: Tom made Mary wash his car.
zh: 汤姆让玛丽洗了他的车。

en: Tom made Mary wash the car.
zh: 汤姆让玛丽洗了那辆车。

en: "Do you like Tom?" "I like him, but I can't see him as a romantic interest."
zh: “你喜欢汤姆吗？”“我喜欢他，但我不能把他看作是恋爱对象。”

en: This kind of mistake is easy to overlook.
zh: 这种错误很容易被忽略。

en: These kinds of mistakes are easy to overlook.
zh: 这些错误很容易被忽略。

en: The large intestine is about 1.5m long.
The stomach connects to the small intestine.
The small intestine is about seven meters long.
The small intestine consists of three parts.
I don't want you to wake him up.

zh: 我们收到了一些新信息。

en: I want to become an astronaut.

zh: 东京是个消费高的城市。

en: That's enough! Open your eyes and wake up now!
zh: 够了！睁开你的眼睛，现在醒来！

en: The worth of a thing is best known by the want of it.
This sweater is comfortable to take off and put on.
zh: 这件毛衣穿脱都很舒服。

en: When did Tom start working here?
zh: 汤姆什么时候开始在这里工作的？

en: How many years did Tom work here?
zh: 汤姆在这里工作了多少年？

en: I've got something I want to show you.
There's something I want you to see.
zh: 有些东西我想让你看看。
汤姆没有回答你的问题。

en: I shouldn't have gone home late at night by myself.
zh: 我真不应该大晚上自己回家。

en: Tom and I went to the same high school.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。

en: Tom and I went to the same high school. He was a year behind me.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。他比我低一年级。

en: Tom and I went to the same high school. He was two years below me.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。他比我低两年级。

en: Tom and I go to the same high school.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。

en: Tom and I went to the same high school. He was a year ahead of me.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。他比我高一年级。

en: Tom and I went to the same high school. He was two years above me.
zh: 我和汤姆上同一所高中。他比我高两年级。

en: I have arrived at the train station.
I'm asking you, so please stop.
zh: 我在问你呢，请你停下来。

en: I want you to love me for who I am.
zh: 我希望你爱的是真正的我。

en: He must be a quack doctor.
Honestly, I don't think you have what it takes to become a teacher.
zh: 说实话，我不认为你具备成为一名教师的素质。

en: She figured as a gray eminence.
zh: 她被认为是幕后操纵者。

en: I can't read cursive, so could you write in block letters, please?
zh: 我看不懂草书，所以请你用印刷体写好吗？

en: Could someone make an example sentence using the German word "Beispiel"?
zh: 谁能用德语单词“Beispiel”造一个例句吗？

en: Could someone make an example sentence in German using the word "Beispiel?"
zh: 谁能用“Beispiel”这个词用德语造一个例句吗？

en: This cheese is made from goat's milk.
zh: 这种奶酪是用羊奶做的。

en: I wish I could have spoken more English.
zh: 我希望我当时能多说些英语。

en: I wish there were less homework.
I can't read handwritten script, so could you please write it in printed script?
zh: 我看不懂手写体，所以请你用印刷体写好吗？

en: Frankly speaking, I don't think you have what it takes to become a teacher.
zh: 坦白地说，我不认为你具备成为一名教师的素质。

en: You have something in your pockets, don't you?
Don't make me go back there.
What do you really think about Tom?
zh: 你到底是怎么看待汤姆的？

en: What do you really think of Tom?
zh: 你到底是怎么看待汤姆的？

en: I never want to see that guy again.
zh: 我再也不想见到那家伙了。

en: I didn't know Tom spoke French.
zh: 我不知道汤姆会说法语。

en: Checks should be made payable to the ABC Company.
I didn't know that you could drive.
She likes to talk about herself.
I'm not going to school today.
I assume it was Tom's idea.
I assume you are talking about Tom.
I assume you're talking about Tom.
They were in that room with me all night.
zh: 他们整晚都和我待在那个房间里。

en: It's not legal for people under 20 to drink in Canada.
zh: 在加拿大，20岁以下的人饮酒是违法的。

en: The longsword was sheathed in an intricately engraved scabbard.
zh: 长剑插在雕刻精美的剑鞘里。

en: I believe his name is Tom.
I bet Tom would be a good teacher.
zh: 我打赌汤姆会是个好老师。

en: It's a little expensive for lunch, but the taste matches the price.
zh: 午餐有点贵，但是味道对得起这个价格。

en: She was abducted by aliens from the planet Tatoeba.
zh: 她被来自Tatoeba星球的外星人绑架了。

en: She sells seashells by the seashore.
I don't think that many people can say they're satisfied with their salary.
zh: 我认为没多少人能说他们对自己的工资感到满意。

en: I don't think that many people can say they are satisfied with their salary.
zh: 我认为没多少人能说他们对自己的工资感到满意。

en: I don't think many people can say they're satisfied with their salary.
zh: 我觉得没多少人会说他们对自己的工资感到满意。

en: I don't know what you're talking about!
Tom hasn't had anything but water since last night.
zh: 自从昨晚以来，汤姆什么都没吃，只喝水。

en: Rice does not like moisture. Be sure to store it well.
zh: 大米不喜欢潮湿。一定要好好储存。

en: I called you here to help me.
zh: 我叫你来这里是为了帮助我。

en: I wrote my teacher a love letter and he read it in front of the whole class.
zh: 我给我的老师写了一封情书，他在全班同学面前读了它。

en: I came here to see Tom.
zh: 我来这里是为了见汤姆。

en: I came to see the show.
I read The Great Gatsby when I was in high school.
zh: 我高中时读了《了不起的盖茨比》。

en: There's a sauna and a pool.
zh: 这里有桑拿房和游泳池。

en: I can no longer fulfill my obligations.
zh: 我再也无法履行我的义务了。

en: I can see why you don't like Tom.
zh: 我能理解你为什么不喜欢汤姆。

en: The bride was wearing a white wedding dress.
zh: 新娘穿着一件白色的婚纱。

en: I can't believe it's raining again.
zh: 我真不敢相信又下雨了。

en: Don’t bother explaining. Because I’m not interested.
zh: 别费力解释了。因为我没兴趣。
我讨厌像他这样的警察。

en: I find the sound of the rain relaxing.
She dreamed of becoming a ballerina.
zh: 她梦想成为一名芭蕾舞演员。

en: Is it a compliment or an insult?
